title: Ogden Water Walking Route

images.title: John Illingworth / Ogden Water commemorative plaque, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ogden Water commemorative plaque Ogden Water reservoir was completed in 1857 to provide water for Halifax and the area round it was used as a place to "take the air" from the outset.

images.caption: Children walk along a surfaced track next to the reservoir on a summer day.

images.title: Janet Lute / Ogden Water, near Halifax
images.caption: View over the water from the south eastern end.

description: Enjoy fabulous views of the Pennine hills at this country park near Halifax. There is a super waterside path around the 34 acre reservoir while there are other paths leading into the surrounding moors. It's a very picturesque place with nice views across the water to the surrounding woodland and moors. To extend your walking you can pick up a bridleway from the reservoir and head west to Warley Moor Reservoir. It's another very peaceful spot with nice views and sailboats on the water. Our Halifax Walk follows a section of the Hebble Brook which starts from reservoir and travels through Halifax before emptying into the River Calder at Salterhebble.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: In the warmer months there should be an ice cream van in the car park. You can pick up drinks and sweet treats here. If you would like something more substantial then you could head to the Causeway Foot Inn. The inn is located just a short walk east of the car park with a postcode of HX2 8XX for your sat navs. They serve traditional pub classics and have a good selection of ales. Inside there's a comfortable lounge with settees and a large fireplace. There's also a garden area for warmer days.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and lakeside trails are ideal for a dog walk. It's a popular place so expect to meet other owners on your visit. The Causeway Foot Inn mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Also in the Halifax area is the splendid Shibden Park. The popular park has miles of trails with woodland, lakes, gardens and water features to enjoy. From here you can also explore the lovely hills and countryside of the Shibden Valley and Shibden Dale. A few miles to the east there's Horton Bank Country Park to explore. The park includes a nice lakeside trail and a viewpoint with fine views over the city of Bradford and the surrounding Yorkshire Dales. The picturesque Chellow Dene Reservoir is also located near here.

display_address: Ogden Lane, Ogden, Calderdale, West Yorkshire, England, HX2 8XZ, United Kingdom
